citation.article-title: Thiorhodococcus minus, gen. nov., sp. nov., A new purple sulfur bacterium isolated from coastal lagoon sediments.

p.s: Description of Thiorhodococcus minus sp. nov.
Cells spherical, 1.0–2.0 μm in diameter; diplococci are formed during binary fission; gram-negative.
Photosynthetic membrane system of the vesicular type.
Contains bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids of the normal spirilloxanthin series with rhodopin as major pigment.
Phototrophic under anoxic conditions in the light; chemolithotrophic and chemoorganotrophic under microoxic conditions in the dark.
Electron donors for photolithoautotrophic growth: H2, hydrogen sulfide, thiosulfate, and elemental sulfur.
During photolithotrophic growth with reduced sulfur compounds, elemental sulfur globules are formed and randomly stored inside the cells.
In the presence of sulfide and hydrogen carbonate, acetate, propionate, lactate, glycolate, pyruvate, malate, fumarate, succinate, fructose, sucrose, ethanol, and propanol are photoassimilated.
Chemoorganotrophic growth occurs with acetate and fructose; chemolithotrophic growth occurs with sulfide and thiosulfate.
Type strain not capable of assimilatory sulfate reduction.
Optimal pH 7.0–7.2; pH range 6.0–8.0; optimal salinity 2% NaCl, salinity range 0.5-9% NaCl; optimal temperature 30–35°C.
DNA base composition of the type strain: 66.9 mol% G+C (HPLC).
Habitat: anoxic sediments from coastal lagoons and marine environments rich in sulfide.
Type strain: strain CE2203T isolated from the brackish lagoons of Certes, Arcachon Bay, France.
Deposited with the German Collection of Microorganisms in Braunschweig, Germany (DSMZ no. 11518 and with the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC no. 700259).
16S rRNA gene sequence deposited in EMBL under accession no. Y11316.
